body.p: The Reprocessor stream takes records rejected in the Business logic stream back into processing. It consists of only one standalone node, CG Reprocessor Node, which is a schedulable node that can be run manually or scheduled to be run at a certain time. It is recommended to run the node manually only when needed.

If there are rejected records, the cause of the rejection must be identified and the CDR streams updated accordingly. After that, CG Reprocessor Node can be run to feed the rejected records back into the Business logic stream.

section.title: Scaling
section.p: CG Reprocessor Node can be scaled by adjusting the number of computation threads in node parameter ComputationThreads.
Having multiple instances of the Reprocessor stream is currently not supported. There must be only one Reprocessor stream running at a time.
